message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with locally decodable codes, which are a topic in information theory (cs.IT) and theoretical computer science (cs.CC). The paper also involves constructing a basis for a copy of $\ell_1^k$, which is a topic in computational geometry (cs.CG) and numerical analysis (cs.NA). Finally, the paper discusses lower bounds on the length of LDCs, which is a topic in data structures (cs.DS).
